intro: Quiabentia zehntneri, commonly known as the Zehntner's quillwort, is a rare aquatic plant belonging to the family Characeae. It is characterized by its long, slender stems and small, spirally arranged leaves that resemble quills. This species is typically found in freshwater habitats with soft, muddy substrates. Its reproductive structures include spores that are released into the water for dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
